bill_title: revise certain provisions related to liability for trespass by certain animals.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to liability for trespass by certain animals. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 40-28-4 be amended to read as follows: 40-28-4. Except as in this chapter otherwise provided, any person owning or having in his charge or possession of any horses, mules, cattle, goats, sheep, or swine, which such animals shall swine, buffalo, or any domestic or captive nondomestic animals that trespass upon the land, either fenced or unfenced, owned by or , in possession of any person , or being cropped by any person injured by such the trespass, shall be is liable to any such the person injured for all damages sustained by reason of such trespassing the trespass . No person shall be is liable under this chapter where if the person injured has maintained an inadequate partition fence and notice thereof has been given pursuant to § 43-23-5 or if he the person is not required to build such fence because of frozen earth pursuant to § 43-23-7. Section 2. That § 40-28-5 be amended to read as follows: 40-28-5. No person shall be is liable for damages caused by horses, cattle, mules, goats, or sheep owned by him, which sheep, swine, buffalo, or other domestic or captive nondomestic animals owned by the person, that trespass upon lands within the exterior boundaries of the Black Hills and Harney national forests, which National Forest, if the lands were not at the time of the trespass inclosed enclosed by a legal fence, as defined in § § 43-23-3 and 43-23-4. Section 3. That § 40-28-6 be amended to read as follows: 40-28-6. The person claiming injury from trespass of livestock by any animal specified in § 40-28-4 , before commencing action thereon , shall notify the owner or person having in charge such livestock of the animal , of the injury and probable amount of the damages, provided he knows to whom such livestock belongs if the person claiming injury knows to whom the animal belongs . Section 4. That § 40-28-7 be amended to read as follows: 40-28-7. Any person suffering injury from trespass of livestock by any animal specified in § 40-28-4 may retain and keep in custody such any offending animal or animals until the damages and costs are paid, or until good and sufficient security be is given for the same .
